results.title: Judaism: the religion of a people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The religious practices and laws of Judaism have been handed down intact over many milleniums. This program looks at the foundations of Jewish teaching and laws as well as giving insight into the history of the Jewish people and their struggle to keep their identity and homeland.

results.title: Judah Waten
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and Darrelyn Gunzburg
results.brief_description: In an interview conducted at his home in Victoria in December 1982, Judah Waten discusses his writing, his life, his Jewish background, political views and Russian, Yiddish and Australian influences on his writing, including the experiences of migrants. This is interspersed with brief remarks by a number of his friends, including Manning Clark, Justice Judith Cohen and Alan Marshall.

results.title: Jubilee Jamboree
results.brief_description: A record of the International Boy Scouts Jamboree held at Sutton Park, near Birmingham in August 1957 to celebrate 50 years of scouting and the centenary of the birth of the founder, Lord Baden Powell. 35,000 scouts attending representing 85 different countries.

results.title: Jubilee and beyond
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A non-narrated impression of the Royal visit to Melbourne, in the Queen’s Jubilee year, in 1977. Showing behind the scene preparations by the Army and Navy personnel, news crews, teachers and school children. The actual event is intercut with students from McRobertson Girls High School and Melbourne High School conducting a debate about the role of the Monarchy in Australia, touching on the issue of republic as an alternative. A good discussion starter on a ‘hot’ issue. (Includes shot of the half-built Westgate Bridge and Melbourne city skyline).

results.title: Jubilee
results.brief_description: A bizarre look at the transition of the centuries from one of the world’s most fertile imaginations.

results.title: Jubilee
results.brief_description: Queen Elizabeth I is transported by her astrologer into the latter part of the 20th century, and is appalled by what she sees in this punk rock era. Outrageous dissection of modern urban life, full of black jokes, it has the right attitudes but is not free of a determination to shock at all costs.

results.title: Jubal
results.creator_credit: William Fadiman, Columbia Pictures and Delmer Daves
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Paul Wellman, this is a loose reworking of Shakepeare’s Othello into a western setting. Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford), a drifter given a job by his friend, a rancher Shep Horgan (Borgnine), makes an enemy of the range rider (Steiger) when Shep’s restless wife, Mae, is attracted to the newcomer. Driven by jealousy, Pinky sets out to frame Jubal and plants in Shep’s mind the suspicion that Jubal is carrying on with Mae. Wanting to hurt both Shep who she doesn’t love, and Jubal who has spurned her, Mae untruthfully confirms Pinky’s story. Shep goes gunning for Jubalm and the heat of the Wild West is matched by the passions at Horgan’s ranch, as anger turns to treachery…and murder.

results.title: Ju dou
results.creator_credit: China Film, Takuma Shoten Publishing Company, Wenze Zhang, Jian Hu, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Zhang Yimou and Yang Feng-Liang
results.brief_description: Ju Dou (Gong Li), the third wife of an impotent and abusive silk merchant Jinshan (Li Wei), finds herself seducing and ultimately falling in love with her husband’s nephew; a seemingly inevitable outcome of a loveless marriage. Jinshan’s abusive nature stems from his frustration at his wives’ inability to conceive (in reality he is sterile). Ju Dou feels this abuse when she too has trouble conceiving. Trouble develops when Ju Dou falls pregnant with her lover’s child, and an explosive situation develops as the child grows and begins to resemble the appearance of his natural father and not Jinshan. Cast includes Gong Li, Li Wei, and Li Baotian. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Banned by the Chinese Government, this film was nominated for an Academy Award for best foreign film, the first Chinese film to receive such a nomination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: China Film, Takuma Shoten Publishing Company, Wenze Zhang, Jian Hu, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Zhang Yimou and Yang Feng-Liang

results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Lee Eun, CJ Entertainment, KTB Network, Myung Film and Park Chan-Wook
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.

results.title: Joyful and triumphant
results.brief_description: Shows commercialisation of Christmas as evidence of public apathy to Christianity. Scenes of Christmas shopping are interspersed with the celebration of the Mass and a Nativity scene. Filmed without dialogue or narration. Photography by Bruce McNaughton.
